title: Chili-garlic Prawns With Chinese Noodles
summary: Chili-garlic Prawns With Chinese Noodles is a dairy free and pescatarian recipe with 4 servings. For $3.68 per serving, this recipe covers 16% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. One portion of this dish contains approximately 40g of protein, 14g of fat, and a total of 617 calories. It works well as a rather expensive main course. 2 people have made this recipe and would make it again. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 10 minutes. This recipe is typical of Chinese cuisine. A mixture of green onions, garlic cloves, chili garlic wok sauce, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so yummy. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 47%. This score is solid. Try Green Prawns with Chinese Noodles, Garlic chilli prawns with sesame noodles, and Prawns With Lemon, Chili, Garlic & Feta for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Riesling, and Sauvignon Blanc are my top picks for Shrimp. These crisp white wines work well with shrimp prepared in a variety of ways, whether grilled, fried, or in garlic sauce. The Alsace Willm Pinot Gris Reserve with a 4.4 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 16 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Alsace Willm Pinot Gris Reserve
productMatches.description: An intense golden color with hints of ocher, the wine has a nose of ripe fruit, quince. In the mouth the attack is both supple and full, with notes of honey and spices. The final perfectly balances sugar and acidity.Pair this wine alongside pan-fried foie gras, grilled or roasted white meats (pork, veal), rabbit, poultry in cream sauce, smoked fish, mushroom dishes such as risotto.
